lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Rich garments, linens, stuffs and necessaries,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which since have steaded much; so, of his gentleness,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Knowing I loved my books, he furnish'd me
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: From mine own library with volumes that
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I prize above my dukedom.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Would I might
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: But ever see that man!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Now I arise:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Sit still, and hear the last of our sea-sorrow.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Here in this island we arrived; and here
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Have I, thy schoolmaster, made thee more profit
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Than other princesses can that have more time
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For vainer hours and tutors not so careful.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Heavens thank you for't! And now, I pray you, sir,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: For still 'tis beating in my mind, your reason
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: For raising this sea-storm?
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Know thus far forth.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: By accident most strange, bountiful Fortune,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Now my dear lady, hath mine enemies
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Brought to this shore; and by my prescience
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I find my zenith doth depend upon
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A most auspicious star, whose influence
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: If now I court not but omit, my fortunes
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Will ever after droop. Here cease more questions:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou art inclined to sleep; 'tis a good dulness,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And give it way: I know thou canst not choose.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come away, servant, come. I am ready now.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Approach, my Ariel, come.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: All hail, great master! grave sir, hail! I come
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: To answer thy best pleasure; be't to fly,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: To swim, to dive into the fire, to ride
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: On the curl'd clouds, to thy strong bidding task
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Ariel and all his quality.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hast thou, spirit,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Perform'd to point the tempest that I bade thee?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: To every article.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I boarded the king's ship; now on the beak,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Now in the waist, the deck, in every cabin,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I flamed amazement: sometime I'ld divide,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And burn in many places; on the topmast,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: The yards and bowsprit, would I flame distinctly,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Then meet and join. Jove's lightnings, the precursors
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: O' the dreadful thunder-claps, more momentary
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And sight-outrunning were not; the fire and cracks
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Of sulphurous roaring the most mighty Neptune
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Seem to besiege and make his bold waves tremble,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Yea, his dread trident shake.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My brave spirit!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Who was so firm, so constant, that this coil
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Would not infect his reason?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Not a soul
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: But felt a fever of the mad and play'd
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Some tricks of desperation. All but mariners
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Plunged in the foaming brine and quit the vessel,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Then all afire with me: the king's son, Ferdinand,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: With hair up-staring,--then like reeds, not hair,--
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Was the first man that leap'd; cried, 'Hell is empty
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And all the devils are here.'
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Why that's my spirit!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But was not this nigh shore?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Close by, my master.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But are they, Ariel, safe?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Not a hair perish'd;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: On their sustaining garments not a blemish,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: But fresher than before: and, as thou badest me,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: In troops I have dispersed them 'bout the isle.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: The king's son have I landed by himself;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: In an odd angle of the isle and sitting,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: His arms in this sad knot.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of the king's ship
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The mariners say how thou hast disposed
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And all the rest o' the fleet.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Safely in harbour
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Is the king's ship; in the deep nook, where once
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Thou call'dst me up at midnight to fetch dew
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: From the still-vex'd Bermoothes, there she's hid:
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: The mariners all under hatches stow'd;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Who, with a charm join'd to their suffer'd labour,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I have left asleep; and for the rest o' the fleet
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Which I dispersed, they all have met again
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And are upon the Mediterranean flote,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Bound sadly home for Naples,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Supposing that they saw the king's ship wreck'd
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And his great person perish.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Ariel, thy charge
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Exactly is perform'd: but there's more work.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What is the time o' the day?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Past the mid season.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: At least two glasses. The time 'twixt six and now
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Must by us both be spent most preciously.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Is there more toil? Since thou dost give me pains,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Let me remember thee what thou hast promised,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Which is not yet perform'd me.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: How now? moody?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What is't thou canst demand?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: My liberty.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Before the time be out? no more!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I prithee,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Remember I have done thee worthy service;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Told thee no lies, made thee no mistakings, served
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Without or grudge or grumblings: thou didst promise
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: To bate me a full year.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Dost thou forget
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: From what a torment I did free thee?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou dost, and think'st it much to tread the ooze
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of the salt deep,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To run upon the sharp wind of the north,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To do me business in the veins o' the earth
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: When it is baked with frost.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I do not, sir.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou liest, malignant thing! Hast thou forgot
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The foul witch Sycorax, who with age and envy
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Was grown into a hoop? hast thou forgot her?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: No, sir.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou hast. Where was she born? speak; tell me.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Sir, in Argier.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: O, was she so? I must
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Once in a month recount what thou hast been,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which thou forget'st. This damn'd witch Sycorax,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For mischiefs manifold and sorceries terrible
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To enter human hearing, from Argier,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou know'st, was banish'd: for one thing she did
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: They would not take her life. Is not this true?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Ay, sir.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: This blue-eyed hag was hither brought with child
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And here was left by the sailors. Thou, my slave,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As thou report'st thyself, wast then her servant;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And, for thou wast a spirit too delicate
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To act her earthy and abhorr'd commands,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Refusing her grand hests, she did confine thee,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: By help of her more potent ministers
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And in her most unmitigable rage,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Into a cloven pine; within which rift
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Imprison'd thou didst painfully remain
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A dozen years; within which space she died
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And left thee there; where thou didst vent thy groans
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As fast as mill-wheels strike. Then was this island--
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Save for the son that she did litter here,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A freckled whelp hag-born--not honour'd with
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A human shape.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Yes, Caliban her son.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Dull thing, I say so; he, that Caliban
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Whom now I keep in service. Thou best know'st
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What torment I did find thee in; thy groans
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Did make wolves howl and penetrate the breasts
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of ever angry bears: it was a torment
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To lay upon the damn'd, which Sycorax
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Could not again undo: it was mine art,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: When I arrived and heard thee, that made gape
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The pine and let thee out.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I thank thee, master.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: If thou more murmur'st, I will rend an oak
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And peg thee in his knotty entrails till
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou hast howl'd away twelve winters.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Pardon, master;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I will be correspondent to command
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And do my spiriting gently.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Do so, and after two days
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I will discharge thee.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: That's my noble master!
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: What shall I do? say what; what shall I do?
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Go make thyself like a nymph o' the sea: be subject
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To no sight but thine and mine, invisible
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To every eyeball else. Go take this shape
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And hither come in't: go, hence with diligence!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Awake, dear heart, awake! thou hast slept well; Awake!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: The strangeness of your story put
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Heaviness in me.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Shake it off. Come on;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: We'll visit Caliban my slave, who never
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Yields us kind answer.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: 'Tis a villain, sir,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: I do not love to look on.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But, as 'tis,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: We cannot miss him: he does make our fire,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fetch in our wood and serves in offices
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That profit us. What, ho! slave! Caliban!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou earth, thou! speak.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: [Within]  There's wood enough within.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come forth, I say! there's other business for thee:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come, thou tortoise! when?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fine apparition! My quaint Ariel,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hark in thine ear.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: My lord it shall be done.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou poisonous slave, got by the devil himself
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Upon thy wicked dam, come forth!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: As wicked dew as e'er my mother brush'd
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: With raven's feather from unwholesome fen
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Drop on you both! a south-west blow on ye
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: And blister you all o'er!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For this, be sure, to-night thou shalt have cramps,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Side-stitches that shall pen thy breath up; urchins
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Shall, for that vast of night that they may work,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: All exercise on thee; thou shalt be pinch'd
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As thick as honeycomb, each pinch more stinging
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Than bees that made 'em.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: I must eat my dinner.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: This island's mine, by Sycorax my mother,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Which thou takest from me. When thou camest first,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Thou strokedst me and madest much of me, wouldst give me
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Water with berries in't, and teach me how
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: To name the bigger light, and how the less,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: That burn by day and night: and then I loved thee
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: And show'd thee all the qualities o' the isle,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: The fresh springs, brine-pits, barren place and fertile:
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Cursed be I that did so! All the charms
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Of Sycorax, toads, beetles, bats, light on you!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: For I am all the subjects that you have,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Which first was mine own king: and here you sty me
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: In this hard rock, whiles you do keep from me
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: The rest o' the island.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou most lying slave,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Whom stripes may move, not kindness! I have used thee,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Filth as thou art, with human care, and lodged thee
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In mine own cell, till thou didst seek to violate
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The honour of my child.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: O ho, O ho! would't had been done!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Thou didst prevent me; I had peopled else
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: This isle with Calibans.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Abhorred slave,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which any print of goodness wilt not take,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Being capable of all ill! I pitied thee,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Took pains to make thee speak, taught thee each hour
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: One thing or other: when thou didst not, savage,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Know thine own meaning, but wouldst gabble like
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A thing most brutish, I endow'd thy purposes
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With words that made them known. But thy vile race,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Though thou didst learn, had that in't which
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: good natures
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Could not abide to be with; therefore wast thou
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Deservedly confined into this rock,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Who hadst deserved more than a prison.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: You taught me language; and my profit on't
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Is, I know how to curse. The red plague rid you
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: For learning me your language!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hag-seed, hence!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fetch us in fuel; and be quick, thou'rt best,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To answer other business. Shrug'st thou, malice?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: If thou neglect'st or dost unwillingly
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What I command, I'll rack thee with old cramps,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fill all thy bones with aches, make thee roar
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That beasts shall tremble at thy din.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: No, pray thee.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: I must obey: his art is of such power,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: It would control my dam's god, Setebos,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: and make a vassal of him.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: So, slave; hence!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL'S song.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come unto these yellow sands,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And then take hands:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Courtsied when you have and kiss'd
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The wild waves whist,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Foot it featly here and there;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And, sweet sprites, the burthen bear.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hark, hark!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The watch-dogs bark!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hark, hark! I hear
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The strain of strutting chanticleer
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Cry, Cock-a-diddle-dow.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Where should this music be? i' the air or the earth?
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: It sounds no more: and sure, it waits upon
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Some god o' the island. Sitting on a bank,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Weeping again the king my father's wreck,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: This music crept by me upon the waters,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Allaying both their fury and my passion
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: With its sweet air: thence I have follow'd it,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Or it hath drawn me rather. But 'tis gone.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: No, it begins again.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Full fathom five thy father lies;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Of his bones are coral made;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Those are pearls that were his eyes:
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Nothing of him that doth fade
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: But doth suffer a sea-change
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Into something rich and strange.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Hark! now I hear them,--Ding-dong, bell.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: The ditty does remember my drown'd father.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: This is no mortal business, nor no sound
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: That the earth owes. I hear it now above me.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The fringed curtains of thine eye advance
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And say what thou seest yond.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: What is't? a spirit?
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Lord, how it looks about! Believe me, sir,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: It carries a brave form. But 'tis a spirit.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: No, wench; it eats and sleeps and hath such senses
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As we have, such. This gallant which thou seest
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Was in the wreck; and, but he's something stain'd
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With grief that's beauty's canker, thou mightst call him
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A goodly person: he hath lost his fellows
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And strays about to find 'em.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: I might call him
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: A thing divine, for nothing natural
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: I ever saw so noble.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: [Aside] It goes on, I see,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As my soul prompts it. Spirit, fine spirit! I'll free thee
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Within two days for this.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Most sure, the goddess
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: On whom these airs attend! Vouchsafe my prayer
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: May know if you remain upon this island;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: And that you will some good instruction give
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: How I may bear me here: my prime request,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Which I do last pronounce, is, O you wonder!
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: If you be maid or no?
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: No wonder, sir;
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: But certainly a maid.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: My language! heavens!
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: I am the best of them that speak this speech,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Were I but where 'tis spoken.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: How? the best?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What wert thou, if the King of Naples heard thee?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: A single thing, as I am now, that wonders
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: To hear thee speak of Naples. He does hear me;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: And that he does I weep: myself am Naples,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Who with mine eyes, never since at ebb, beheld
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: The king my father wreck'd.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Alack, for mercy!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Yes, faith, and all his lords; the Duke of Milan
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: And his brave son being twain.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: [Aside]	The Duke of Milan
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And his more braver daughter could control thee,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: If now 'twere fit to do't. At the first sight
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: They have changed eyes. Delicate Ariel,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I'll set thee free for this.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A word, good sir;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I fear you have done yourself some wrong: a word.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Why speaks my father so ungently? This
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Is the third man that e'er I saw, the first
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: That e'er I sigh'd for: pity move my father
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: To be inclined my way!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: O, if a virgin,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: And your affection not gone forth, I'll make you
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: The queen of Naples.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Soft, sir! one word more.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: They are both in either's powers; but this swift business
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I must uneasy make, lest too light winning
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Make the prize light.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: One word more; I charge thee
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That thou attend me: thou dost here usurp
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The name thou owest not; and hast put thyself
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Upon this island as a spy, to win it
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: From me, the lord on't.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: No, as I am a man.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: There's nothing ill can dwell in such a temple:
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: If the ill spirit have so fair a house,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Good things will strive to dwell with't.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Follow me.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Speak not you for him; he's a traitor. Come;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I'll manacle thy neck and feet together:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Sea-water shalt thou drink; thy food shall be
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The fresh-brook muscles, wither'd roots and husks
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Wherein the acorn cradled. Follow.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: No;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: I will resist such entertainment till
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Mine enemy has more power.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: O dear father,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Make not too rash a trial of him, for
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: He's gentle and not fearful.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: What? I say,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My foot my tutor? Put thy sword up, traitor;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Who makest a show but darest not strike, thy conscience
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Is so possess'd with guilt: come from thy ward,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For I can here disarm thee with this stick
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And make thy weapon drop.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Beseech you, father.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hence! hang not on my garments.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Sir, have pity;
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: I'll be his surety.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Silence! one word more
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Shall make me chide thee, if not hate thee. What!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: An advocate for an imposter! hush!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou think'st there is no more such shapes as he,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Having seen but him and Caliban: foolish wench!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To the most of men this is a Caliban
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And they to him are angels.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: My affections
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Are then most humble; I have no ambition
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: To see a goodlier man.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come on; obey:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thy nerves are in their infancy again
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And have no vigour in them.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: So they are;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: My spirits, as in a dream, are all bound up.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: My father's loss, the weakness which I feel,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: The wreck of all my friends, nor this man's threats,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: To whom I am subdued, are but light to me,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Might I but through my prison once a day
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Behold this maid: all corners else o' the earth
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Let liberty make use of; space enough
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Have I in such a prison.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: [Aside]                It works.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come on.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou hast done well, fine Ariel!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Follow me.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hark what thou else shalt do me.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Be of comfort;
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: My father's of a better nature, sir,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Than he appears by speech: this is unwonted
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Which now came from him.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou shalt be free
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As mountain winds: but then exactly do
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: All points of my command.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: To the syllable.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come, follow. Speak not for him.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Beseech you, sir, be merry; you have cause,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: So have we all, of joy; for our escape
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Is much beyond our loss. Our hint of woe
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Is common; every day some sailor's wife,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: The masters of some merchant and the merchant
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Have just our theme of woe; but for the miracle,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: I mean our preservation, few in millions
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Can speak like us: then wisely, good sir, weigh
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Our sorrow with our comfort.
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Prithee, peace.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: He receives comfort like cold porridge.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ANTONIO
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: The visitor will not give him o'er so.
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Look he's winding up the watch of his wit;
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: by and by it will strike.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Sir,--
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: One: tell.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: When every grief is entertain'd that's offer'd,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Comes to the entertainer--
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: A dollar.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Dolour comes to him, indeed: you
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: have spoken truer than you purposed.
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: You have taken it wiselier than I meant you should.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Therefore, my lord,--
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ANTONIO
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: Fie, what a spendthrift is he of his tongue!
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: I prithee, spare.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Though this island seem to be desert,--
lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Ha, ha, ha! So, you're paid.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ADRIAN
lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.value: Uninhabitable and almost inaccessible,--
lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Yet,--
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ADRIAN
lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.value: ANTONIO
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: Temperance was a delicate wench.
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Ay, and a subtle; as he most learnedly delivered.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ADRIAN
lines.speaker: ADRIAN

lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ANTONIO
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Of that there's none, or little.

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ANTONIO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: With an eye of green in't.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ANTONIO

lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: As many vouched rarities are.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: GONZALO

lines.value: ANTONIO

lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: You are three men of sin, whom Destiny,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: That hath to instrument this lower world
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And what is in't, the never-surfeited sea
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Hath caused to belch up you; and on this island
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Where man doth not inhabit; you 'mongst men
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Being most unfit to live. I have made you mad;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And even with such-like valour men hang and drown
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Their proper selves.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: You fools! I and my fellows
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Are ministers of Fate: the elements,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Of whom your swords are temper'd, may as well
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Wound the loud winds, or with bemock'd-at stabs
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Kill the still-closing waters, as diminish
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: One dowle that's in my plume: my fellow-ministers
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Are like invulnerable. If you could hurt,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Your swords are now too massy for your strengths
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And will not be uplifted. But remember--
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: For that's my business to you--that you three
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: From Milan did supplant good Prospero;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Exposed unto the sea, which hath requit it,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Him and his innocent child: for which foul deed
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: The powers, delaying, not forgetting, have
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Incensed the seas and shores, yea, all the creatures,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Against your peace. Thee of thy son, Alonso,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: They have bereft; and do pronounce by me:
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Lingering perdition, worse than any death
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Can be at once, shall step by step attend
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: You and your ways; whose wraths to guard you from--
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Which here, in this most desolate isle, else falls
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Upon your heads--is nothing but heart-sorrow
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And a clear life ensuing.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of my instruction hast thou nothing bated
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In what thou hadst to say: so, with good life
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And observation strange, my meaner ministers
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Their several kinds have done. My high charms work

lines.value: And these mine enemies are all knit up
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In their distractions; they now are in my power;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: O, it is monstrous, monstrous:

lines.value: You sunburnt sicklemen, of August weary,
lines.speaker: IRIS

lines.value: Come hither from the furrow and be merry:
lines.speaker: IRIS

lines.value: Make holiday; your rye-straw hats put on
lines.speaker: IRIS

lines.value: And these fresh nymphs encounter every one
lines.speaker: IRIS

lines.value: In country footing.

lines.value: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of the beast Caliban and his confederates
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Against my life: the minute of their plot
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Is almost come.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Well done! avoid; no more!

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: This is strange: your father's in some passion

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Never till this day
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Saw I him touch'd with anger so distemper'd.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: You do look, my son, in a moved sort,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As if you were dismay'd: be cheerful, sir.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Our revels now are ended. These our actors,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As I foretold you, were all spirits and
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Are melted into air, into thin air:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And, like the baseless fabric of this vision,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The cloud-capp'd towers, the gorgeous palaces,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The solemn temples, the great globe itself,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Ye all which it inherit, shall dissolve
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And, like this insubstantial pageant faded,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Leave not a rack behind. We are such stuff
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As dreams are made on, and our little life
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Is rounded with a sleep. Sir, I am vex'd;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Bear with my weakness; my, brain is troubled:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Be not disturb'd with my infirmity:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: If you be pleased, retire into my cell
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And there repose: a turn or two I'll walk,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To still my beating mind.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Thy thoughts I cleave to. What's thy pleasure?
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Spirit,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: We must prepare to meet with Caliban.

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Ay, my commander: when I presented Ceres,

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Say again, where didst thou leave these varlets?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I told you, sir, they were red-hot with drinking;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: So fun of valour that they smote the air
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: For breathing in their faces; beat the ground
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: For kissing of their feet; yet always bending
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Towards their project. Then I beat my tabour;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: At which, like unback'd colts, they prick'd
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: their ears,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Advanced their eyelids, lifted up their noses
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: As they smelt music: so I charm'd their ears
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: That calf-like they my lowing follow'd through
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Tooth'd briers, sharp furzes, pricking goss and thorns,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Which entered their frail shins: at last I left them
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I' the filthy-mantled pool beyond your cell,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: There dancing up to the chins, that the foul lake
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: O'erstunk their feet.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: This was well done, my bird.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thy shape invisible retain thou still:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The trumpery in my house, go bring it hither,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For stale to catch these thieves.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I go, I go.

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A devil, a born devil, on whose nature
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Nurture can never stick; on whom my pains,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Humanely taken, all, all lost, quite lost;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And as with age his body uglier grows,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: So his mind cankers. I will plague them all,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Even to roaring.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come, hang them on this line.

lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: Be patient, for the prize I'll bring thee to
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Shall hoodwink this mischance: therefore speak softly.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: All's hush'd as midnight yet.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: TRINCULO
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: Ay, but to lose our bottles in the pool,--
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: STEPHANO
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: There is not only disgrace and dishonour in that,
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: monster, but an infinite loss.
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: TRINCULO
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: That's more to me than my wetting: yet this is your

lines.value: harmless fairy, monster.
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: STEPHANO
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: I will fetch off my bottle, though I be o'er ears

lines.value: for my labour.
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Prithee, my king, be quiet. Seest thou here,
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: This is the mouth o' the cell: no noise, and enter.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Do that good mischief which may make this island

lines.value: Thine own for ever, and I, thy Caliban,

lines.value: For aye thy foot-licker.

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Let it alone, thou fool; it is but trash.

lines.value: The dropsy drown this fool I what do you mean

lines.value: Make us strange stuff.

lines.value: country. 'Steal by line and level' is an excellent

lines.value: pass of pate; there's another garment for't.

lines.value: Silver I there it goes, Silver!
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fury, Fury! there, Tyrant, there! hark! hark!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Go charge my goblins that they grind their joints
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With dry convulsions, shorten up their sinews
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With aged cramps, and more pinch-spotted make them
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Than pard or cat o' mountain.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Hark, they roar!
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Let them be hunted soundly. At this hour
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Lie at my mercy all mine enemies:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Shortly shall all my labours end, and thou
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Shalt have the air at freedom: for a little
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Follow, and do me service.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Now does my project gather to a head:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My charms crack not; my spirits obey; and time
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Goes upright with his carriage. How's the day?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: On the sixth hour; at which time, my lord,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: You said our work should cease.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I did say so,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: When first I raised the tempest. Say, my spirit,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: How fares the king and's followers?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Confined together
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: In the same fashion as you gave in charge,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Just as you left them; all prisoners, sir,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: In the line-grove which weather-fends your cell;
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: They cannot budge till your release. The king,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: His brother and yours, abide all three distracted
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: And the remainder mourning over them,
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Brimful of sorrow and dismay; but chiefly
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Him that you term'd, sir, 'The good old lord Gonzalo;'
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: His tears run down his beard, like winter's drops
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: From eaves of reeds. Your charm so strongly works 'em
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: That if you now beheld them, your affections
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Would become tender.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Dost thou think so, spirit?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Mine would, sir, were I human.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And mine shall.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Hast thou, which art but air, a touch, a feeling
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of their afflictions, and shall not myself,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: One of their kind, that relish all as sharply,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Passion as they, be kindlier moved than thou art?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Though with their high wrongs I am struck to the quick,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Yet with my nobler reason 'gaitist my fury
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Do I take part: the rarer action is
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In virtue than in vengeance: they being penitent,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The sole drift of my purpose doth extend
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Not a frown further. Go release them, Ariel:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My charms I'll break, their senses I'll restore,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And they shall be themselves.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I'll fetch them, sir.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Ye elves of hills, brooks, standing lakes and groves,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And ye that on the sands with printless foot
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Do chase the ebbing Neptune and do fly him
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: When he comes back; you demi-puppets that
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: By moonshine do the green sour ringlets make,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Whereof the ewe not bites, and you whose pastime
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Is to make midnight mushrooms, that rejoice
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To hear the solemn curfew; by whose aid,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Weak masters though ye be, I have bedimm'd
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The noontide sun, call'd forth the mutinous winds,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And 'twixt the green sea and the azured vault
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Set roaring war: to the dread rattling thunder
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Have I given fire and rifted Jove's stout oak
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With his own bolt; the strong-based promontory
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Have I made shake and by the spurs pluck'd up
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The pine and cedar: graves at my command
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Have waked their sleepers, oped, and let 'em forth
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: By my so potent art. But this rough magic
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I here abjure, and, when I have required
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Some heavenly music, which even now I do,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To work mine end upon their senses that
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: This airy charm is for, I'll break my staff,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Bury it certain fathoms in the earth,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And deeper than did ever plummet sound
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I'll drown my book.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A solemn air and the best comforter
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To an unsettled fancy cure thy brains,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Now useless, boil'd within thy skull! There stand,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For you are spell-stopp'd.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Holy Gonzalo, honourable man,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Mine eyes, even sociable to the show of thine,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fall fellowly drops. The charm dissolves apace,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And as the morning steals upon the night,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Melting the darkness, so their rising senses
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Begin to chase the ignorant fumes that mantle
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Their clearer reason. O good Gonzalo,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My true preserver, and a loyal sir
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To him you follow'st! I will pay thy graces
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Home both in word and deed. Most cruelly
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Didst thou, Alonso, use me and my daughter:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thy brother was a furtherer in the act.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou art pinch'd fort now, Sebastian. Flesh and blood,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: You, brother mine, that entertain'd ambition,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Expell'd remorse and nature; who, with Sebastian,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Whose inward pinches therefore are most strong,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Would here have kill'd your king; I do forgive thee,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Unnatural though thou art. Their understanding
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Begins to swell, and the approaching tide
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Will shortly fill the reasonable shore
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That now lies foul and muddy. Not one of them
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That yet looks on me, or would know me Ariel,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Fetch me the hat and rapier in my cell:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I will discase me, and myself present
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As I was sometime Milan: quickly, spirit;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou shalt ere long be free.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Where the bee sucks. there suck I:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In a cowslip's bell I lie;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: There I couch when owls do cry.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: On the bat's back I do fly
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: After summer merrily.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Merrily, merrily shall I live now
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Under the blossom that hangs on the bough.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Why, that's my dainty Ariel! I shall miss thee:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But yet thou shalt have freedom: so, so, so.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To the king's ship, invisible as thou art:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: There shalt thou find the mariners asleep
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Under the hatches; the master and the boatswain
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Being awake, enforce them to this place,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And presently, I prithee.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: I drink the air before me, and return

lines.value: Or some enchanted trifle to abuse me,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: As late I have been, I not know: thy pulse
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Beats as of flesh and blood; and, since I saw thee,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: The affliction of my mind amends, with which,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: I fear, a madness held me: this must crave,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: An if this be at all, a most strange story.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Thy dukedom I resign and do entreat
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Thou pardon me my wrongs. But how should Prospero
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Be living and be here?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: First, noble friend,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Let me embrace thine age, whose honour cannot
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Be measured or confined.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Whether this be
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Or be not, I'll not swear.
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: You do yet taste
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Some subtilties o' the isle, that will not let you
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Believe things certain. Welcome, my friends all!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But you, my brace of lords, were I so minded,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I here could pluck his highness' frown upon you
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And justify you traitors: at this time
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I will tell no tales.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: [Aside]  The devil speaks in him.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For you, most wicked sir, whom to call brother
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Would even infect my mouth, I do forgive
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thy rankest fault; all of them; and require
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My dukedom of thee, which perforce, I know,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Thou must restore.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: If thou be'st Prospero,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Give us particulars of thy preservation;
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: How thou hast met us here, who three hours since
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Were wreck'd upon this shore; where I have lost--
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: How sharp the point of this remembrance is!--
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: My dear son Ferdinand.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I am woe for't, sir.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Irreparable is the loss, and patience
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Says it is past her cure.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I rather think
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: You have not sought her help, of whose soft grace
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For the like loss I have her sovereign aid
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And rest myself content.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: You the like loss!
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As great to me as late; and, supportable
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To make the dear loss, have I means much weaker
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Than you may call to comfort you, for I
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Have lost my daughter.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: A daughter?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: O heavens, that they were living both in Naples,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: The king and queen there! that they were, I wish
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Myself were mudded in that oozy bed
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Where my son lies. When did you lose your daughter?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In this last tempest. I perceive these lords
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: At this encounter do so much admire
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That they devour their reason and scarce think
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Their eyes do offices of truth, their words
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Are natural breath: but, howsoe'er you have
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Been justled from your senses, know for certain
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That I am Prospero and that very duke
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which was thrust forth of Milan, who most strangely
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Upon this shore, where you were wreck'd, was landed,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To be the lord on't. No more yet of this;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For 'tis a chronicle of day by day,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Not a relation for a breakfast nor
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Befitting this first meeting. Welcome, sir;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: This cell's my court: here have I few attendants
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And subjects none abroad: pray you, look in.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My dukedom since you have given me again,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I will requite you with as good a thing;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: At least bring forth a wonder, to content ye
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As much as me my dukedom.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Sweet lord, you play me false.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: No, my dear'st love,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: I would not for the world.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: Yes, for a score of kingdoms you should wrangle,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: And I would call it, fair play.
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: If this prove
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: A vision of the Island, one dear son
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Shall I twice lose.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: A most high miracle!
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Though the seas threaten, they are merciful;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: I have cursed them without cause.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Now all the blessings
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Of a glad father compass thee about!
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Arise, and say how thou camest here.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: MIRANDA
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: O, wonder!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: How many goodly creatures are there here!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: How beauteous mankind is! O brave new world,
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: That has such people in't!
lines.speaker: MIRANDA

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: 'Tis new to thee.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: What is this maid with whom thou wast at play?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Your eld'st acquaintance cannot be three hours:
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Is she the goddess that hath sever'd us,
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: And brought us thus together?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: FERDINAND
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Sir, she is mortal;
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: But by immortal Providence she's mine:
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: I chose her when I could not ask my father
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: For his advice, nor thought I had one. She
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Is daughter to this famous Duke of Milan,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Of whom so often I have heard renown,
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: But never saw before; of whom I have
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: Received a second life; and second father
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: This lady makes him to me.
lines.speaker: FERDINAND

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: I am hers:
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: But, O, how oddly will it sound that I
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Must ask my child forgiveness!
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: There, sir, stop:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Let us not burthen our remembrance with
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: A heaviness that's gone.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: I have inly wept,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Or should have spoke ere this. Look down, you god,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: And on this couple drop a blessed crown!
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: For it is you that have chalk'd forth the way
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Which brought us hither.
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: I say, Amen, Gonzalo!
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Was Milan thrust from Milan, that his issue
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Should become kings of Naples? O, rejoice
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Beyond a common joy, and set it down
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: With gold on lasting pillars: In one voyage
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Did Claribel her husband find at Tunis,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: And Ferdinand, her brother, found a wife
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Where he himself was lost, Prospero his dukedom
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: In a poor isle and all of us ourselves
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: When no man was his own.
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: [To FERDINAND and MIRANDA]  Give me your hands:
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Let grief and sorrow still embrace his heart
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: That doth not wish you joy!
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: GONZALO
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Be it so! Amen!
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: O, look, sir, look, sir! here is more of us:
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: I prophesied, if a gallows were on land,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: This fellow could not drown. Now, blasphemy,
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: That swear'st grace o'erboard, not an oath on shore?
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Hast thou no mouth by land? What is the news?
lines.speaker: GONZALO

lines.value: Boatswain
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: The best news is, that we have safely found
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Our king and company; the next, our ship--
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Which, but three glasses since, we gave out split--
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Is tight and yare and bravely rigg'd as when
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: We first put out to sea.
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: [Aside to PROSPERO]  Sir, all this service
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: Have I done since I went.
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: [Aside to ARIEL]  My tricksy spirit!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: These are not natural events; they strengthen
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: From strange to stranger. Say, how came you hither?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Boatswain
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: If I did think, sir, I were well awake,
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: I'ld strive to tell you. We were dead of sleep,
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: And--how we know not--all clapp'd under hatches;
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Where but even now with strange and several noises
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Of roaring, shrieking, howling, jingling chains,
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: And more diversity of sounds, all horrible,
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: We were awaked; straightway, at liberty;
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Where we, in all her trim, freshly beheld
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Our royal, good and gallant ship, our master
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Capering to eye her: on a trice, so please you,
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: Even in a dream, were we divided from them
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: And were brought moping hither.
lines.speaker: Boatswain

lines.value: ARIEL
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: [Aside to PROSPERO]          Was't well done?
lines.speaker: ARIEL

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: [Aside to ARIEL]  Bravely, my diligence. Thou shalt be free.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: This is as strange a maze as e'er men trod
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: And there is in this business more than nature
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Was ever conduct of: some oracle
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Must rectify our knowledge.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Sir, my liege,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Do not infest your mind with beating on
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: The strangeness of this business; at pick'd leisure
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which shall be shortly, single I'll resolve you,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which to you shall seem probable, of every
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: These happen'd accidents; till when, be cheerful
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And think of each thing well.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Come hither, spirit:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Set Caliban and his companions free;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Untie the spell.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: How fares my gracious sir?
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: There are yet missing of your company
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Some few odd lads that you remember not.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: STEPHANO
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: Every man shift for all the rest, and
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: let no man take care for himself; for all is
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: but fortune. Coragio, bully-monster, coragio!
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: TRINCULO
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: If these be true spies which I wear in my head,
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: here's a goodly sight.
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: CALIBAN
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: O Setebos, these be brave spirits indeed!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: How fine my master is! I am afraid
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: He will chastise me.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Ha, ha!
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: What things are these, my lord Antonio?
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Will money buy 'em?
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ANTONIO
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: Very like; one of them
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: Is a plain fish, and, no doubt, marketable.
lines.speaker: ANTONIO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Mark but the badges of these men, my lords,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Then say if they be true. This mis-shapen knave,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: His mother was a witch, and one so strong
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That could control the moon, make flows and ebbs,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And deal in her command without her power.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: These three have robb'd me; and this demi-devil--
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For he's a bastard one--had plotted with them
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To take my life. Two of these fellows you

lines.value: Must know and own; this thing of darkness!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Acknowledge mine.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: I shall be pinch'd to death.
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Is not this Stephano, my drunken butler?
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: He is drunk now: where had he wine?
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: And Trinculo is reeling ripe: where should they

lines.value: Find this grand liquor that hath gilded 'em?

lines.value: TRINCULO
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: I have been in such a pickle since I

lines.value: saw you last that, I fear me, will never out of

lines.value: my bones: I shall not fear fly-blowing.
lines.speaker: TRINCULO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Why, how now, Stephano!
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: STEPHANO
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: O, touch me not; I am not Stephano, but a cramp.

lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: I should have been a sore one then.
lines.speaker: STEPHANO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: This is a strange thing as e'er I look'd on.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: He is as disproportion'd in his manners
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As in his shape. Go, sirrah, to my cell;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Take with you your companions; as you look
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To have my pardon, trim it handsomely.

lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: Ay, that I will; and I'll be wise hereafter
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: And seek for grace. What a thrice-double ass

lines.value: Was I, to take this drunkard for a god

lines.value: And worship this dull fool!
lines.speaker: CALIBAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Go to; away!
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Hence, and bestow your luggage where you found it.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: SEBASTIAN
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: Or stole it, rather.
lines.speaker: SEBASTIAN

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Sir, I invite your highness and your train
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: To my poor cell, where you shall take your rest
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: For this one night; which, part of it, I'll waste
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With such discourse as, I not doubt, shall make it
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Go quick away; the story of my life
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And the particular accidents gone by
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Since I came to this isle: and in the morn
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I'll bring you to your ship and so to Naples,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Where I have hope to see the nuptial
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Of these our dear-beloved solemnized;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And thence retire me to my Milan, where
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Every third thought shall be my grave.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: ALONSO
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: I long
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: To hear the story of your life, which must
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: Take the ear strangely.
lines.speaker: ALONSO

lines.value: PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I'll deliver all;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And promise you calm seas, auspicious gales
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And sail so expeditious that shall catch
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Your royal fleet far off.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: My Ariel, chick,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: That is thy charge: then to the elements
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Be free, and fare thou well! Please you, draw near.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: EPILOGUE
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: SPOKEN BY PROSPERO
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Now my charms are all o'erthrown,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And what strength I have's mine own,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which is most faint: now, 'tis true,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: I must be here confined by you,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Or sent to Naples. Let me not,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Since I have my dukedom got
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And pardon'd the deceiver, dwell
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: In this bare island by your spell;
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: But release me from my bands
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: With the help of your good hands:
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Gentle breath of yours my sails
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Must fill, or else my project fails,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which was to please. Now I want
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Spirits to enforce, art to enchant,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: And my ending is despair,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Unless I be relieved by prayer,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Which pierces so that it assaults
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Mercy itself and frees all faults.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: As you from crimes would pardon'd be,
lines.speaker: PROSPERO

lines.value: Let your indulgence set me free.
lines.speaker: PROSPERO
